as I stood there in the server room I could feel the Goosebumps go up and down my

colleagues I hadn't packed any luggage and I hadn't told my

through on my phone when we go through things like this what's happening is our body and
our brains are literally trying to shut us down to stop us from doing what we're
doing to ourselves to prevent us from putting ourselves in those
situations some people might get Tremors or shakes and that might be some of the signs or symptoms that they notice in

was time to wake up in the morning it was such an effort to drag myself out of
bed so what does that look like to the people around us did my colleagues
notice that any of this stuff was going on in my world and what do we need to

and someone who's having a rough time we expect it to look like this we expect

and looking like they're not not coping sometimes burnout looks like this
especially in our IT industry with Hyper performing individuals who just go in and get the work done burnout can look

to either flight or get the heck out of that situation because of this we get a depression we

tell me if there are new messages and that's Twitter and Microsoft teams so

program I call it Shing as inbox because until I go in there I don't know whether

in on my phone and the reason I did that was because I woke up on a Saturday morning and I work in a global team so

Friday and they're Friday afternoon so they're all busy working away so I wake
up on a Saturday morning about two or three weeks into this team and I have
21 on that unread badge 21 new emails in my inbox and it's
supposed to be my weekend and I'm not supposed to be working and it is killing
me to go what the heck has gone on while I've been asleep that I've got 21 new
emails so from that day on I turned off that unread badge and now whenever I

make the papers that have gone through depression or suicide and yeah you know
it's a um it's an issue that creeps up in our very own workplace
and we want to help each other out right we want to know what to do you can start by being a good example
especially if you manage people they need to see you taking your
annual leave they need to see you saying I'm going to take tomorrow off because I

context when you're not traveling so well and the things that you're doing to address it it makes it okay for other

less resources than we had before and everybody's stressed about it so if if you see things like that in your
workplace speak up about it push back on that stuff you know Hit The Boss up if
they really are unrealistic deadlines and it might not be for your benefit it might be because you see that there are
other people struggling in the team who don't feel like they have a strength and confidence in their voice right now to
speak up about things like that and we also need to start valuing
other types of contribution and our Workforce so it's really easy
for us to turn around and say this person's a rock star like they've delivered talks at 10 different

production of the work that we do that's equally as valuable that's not quite
rock star shiny and that could be things like writing documentation or doing some

have been in situations like that sit down and have a deep breath and a Poston

but it's not a badge of Shame either when we're asking somebody how

fine I'm good it's fine nothing to see here move along so instead I'm going to give you
some tough questions to ask things like I've noticed you're not quite yourself lately can we talk okay

do I have your permission to open up a conversation tell me specifically what

better questions to ask our colleagues and if you find somebody
who's going through a tough time especially if you are their manager it's a natural instinct to parent
somebody who's struggling we want to take the bad thing away and so we
normally do that by taking away some of their workload right we think we're helping them out we're taught to walk in
somebody else's shoes put yourself in their shoes don't do that you put yourself in
somebody else's shoes it's still you you're just wearing different shoes so instead I want to encourage you
to ask the person what matters the most to them right now now this comes from a guy called Brady Wilson he's got a tedex
talk on how to fix the exhausted brain and he says that in any situation there
are five things that our brain might need to help bring us out of exhaustion
one of them is a sense of meaning knowing that what we are doing is
important knowing that the work has value and it's going to achieve a result
for someone feeling like what we're doing is Meaningful the other is belong
do I feel like I'm part of the team do I get the jokes and do I feel like this is
my family or is everything just going over my head and I'm not feeling
included do I need a better sense of security do I need more guidance and
guide rails and Direction around what I'm working on because it just feels all too vague or maybe I need some more
freedom maybe I'm being far too constrained in and I'm trying to do do
stuff and I want to push the envelope but I'm just not getting supported and the last thing is
significance do I matter in the team am I valuable and am I important for what
I'm doing and what I bring to the table and these kind of things vary depending on the person and the situation you can
flip from one to another depending on what situation they're in but there was a story about a manager who had taken
some workload of somebody who was suffering from burnout and things just weren't getting
better and he couldn't understand why so he had this kind of a conversation and
said to the person you know what matters the most to you right now and she
said I don't feel challenged enough the work that I'm doing is pretty mundane
and boring and I'm just tired of it and when I come and I talk to you about how
I'm feeling you just take more work away from me so he started giving her the
challenging tasks the hardest stuff for her to really sink her teeth into and
she Shawn absolutely lifted a game loved her job again and it was because this
was what she was Ling it wasn't that she wanted less work she just wanted something a bit more
challenging so now you get to really raise your hand what I would like to see
from you is a commitment that you will either Implement one of these things to help
improve your own life or you'll Implement one of these steps the next time you see one of your
